findings.title: Lack of input validation
findings.description: Functions do not check if arguments of type address are non-zero

findings.title: Timestamp dependence
findings.description: The smart contract relies on timestamp which can be manipulated by miners or other actors.

findings.title: Mishandled exceptions and call stack limits
Various calls to ERC20 functions are not in require statements
findings.description: Calls to ERC20 functions on external assets are not wrapped in `require()` statements.

findings.title: Potential Division by Zero
findings.description: There is a chance that `ConfigProvider.minCollateralRatio` is set to 0, which would cause division by zero in `LiquidationManager.sol#63`.

findings.title: Reentrancy and cross-function vulnerabilities
findings.description: Reentrancy vulnerability found in FeeDistributor.changePayees() and ConfigProvider.setCollateralConfig() functions.

findings.title: Privileged Roles and Ownership
findings.description: Centralization of power in contracts EURX, USDX, FeeDistributor, AddressProvider, ConfigProvider, PriceFeed, and PriceFeedEUR due to owner and manager roles.
findings.contract: Multiple (EURX, USDX, FeeDistributor, AddressProvider, ConfigProvider, PriceFeed, PriceFeedEUR)

findings.title: Centralization of Power
findings.description: The contracts EURX, USDX, FeeDistributor, AddressProvider, ConfigProvider, PriceFeed, and PriceFeedEUR have a special role (minter or manager) that can set arbitrary parameters, which needs to be made clear to the users.
findings.contract: Multiple Contracts (EURX, USDX, FeeDistributor, AddressProvider, ConfigProvider, PriceFeed, PriceFeedEUR)

findings.title: Business logic contradicting the specification
findings.description: The flowchart for function borrow is not in the same order as the implementation. The health check occurs after updating total balance, total income and total debt.

findings.title: Code clones, functionality duplication
findings.description: The code contains duplicated functionality which can lead to maintenance and security issues.
